s.text: Oh, I how long to be a fly on the wall for that conversation.
And among the people most annoyed by the company's late announcement are those same analysts.
When analysts call, looking for information that will help their clients and only their clients, companies should just say, "Buzz off.
Unfortunately, Maytag investors didn't find that out until the company announced the shortfall Friday morning, after two full days of massive selling on no news at all.
And I'd say this was astonishing, except for the fact that selective disclosure remains a painfully common practice.
